channel.title: Fragmented-MP4 on Min-Jae Lee
channel.description: Recent content in Fragmented-MP4 on Min-Jae Lee

item.title: Thought about latency
item.description: Problem Current design was RTMP for Ingest, fMP4 for remain RTMP and MPEG-TS are passing frame by frame fMP4 is passing GoP(Group of Pictures) by GoP So, Additional delay(key-frame interval) occured on each reconstruction of media container If key-frame interval is 2 seconds Streamer to viewer delay will be like below Capture frame $\frac{1}{FPS}\text{sec.}$ Encoding delay Network delay Waiting for GoP $2\text{sec.}$ Passing into transcoder Waiting for GoP $2\text{sec.

item.title: Fragmented MP4
item.description: What is Fragmented MP4 MP4 is defined in ISOBMFF. Mandatory, minimum ISOBMFF is a set of ftyp, mdat, moov. (def boxes-per-row 4) (draw-column-headers) (draw-box "ftyp" {:span 4}) (draw-gap "mdat") (draw-box "moov" {:span 4}) ftyp has compatible information. mdat has real media data. moov has metadata and sample information such as data offset, size and other information that required for decode. The point of Fragmented is sample information.
